intro: Balaustion baiocalyx, commonly known as the white-flowered balaustion, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The fruit is a small, dry capsule that contains several seeds.
